DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Etiology Acute Myeloid Leukemia Diagnosis Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a description for the cause (origin) of development of acute myeloid leukemia based on examination of a person and their medical history to identify exposure to treatments or associated risks.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Etiology Acute Myeloid Leukemia Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the cause (origin) resulting in development of acute myeloid leukemia based on examination of a person and their medical history to identify exposure to treatments or associated risks.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:The cause of a disease.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

Property.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.: An acute myeloid leukemia arising as a result of the mutagenic effect of chemotherapy agents and/or ionizing radiation.  (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.

Concepts.longName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Post Cytotoxic Therapy
Concepts.definition: An acute myeloid leukemia arising as a result of the mutagenic effect of chemotherapy agents and/or ionizing radiation.  (WHO, 2001)
